title: About
text:
Hello! My name is Kirya and I’m from Corona, California. I have always been active and involved in various sports growing up (like tennis and soccer), but I have recently been getting into pickleball!
My ideal free-time activity consists of anything outside, such as laying in the sun or doing something active with friends. I specifically love hiking and finding bodies of water to take a dip in. I also really enjoy camping, I usually go on road trips once or twice a year to get outside and enjoy nature a little. 
I have always loved cats, and I currently have three lovely kitties back home. They are so sweet and bring me a lot of joy. Recently, I have been introduced to the joys of songbirds! After working in wildlife rehabilitation at SBWCN and getting to learn about the vast species of birds in California, I have grown to appreciate them so much more. Therefore, my new future hobby is bird watching.

My name is Kirya Wagner and I am a second-year student at UC Santa Barbara majoring in Environmental Studies. My interests in the environment are currently broad, but I am leaning in the direction of environmental monitoring, conservation and ecology.



University of California, Santa Barbara | Santa Barbara, CA BS in Environmental Science | Sept 2023 - June 2026 | GPA 3.65
University of Waikato | Hamilton, NZ | June 2024 - November 2024

title: Kirya Wagner
text:
Science and Math: General Chemistry • Introduction to Biology • Plant and Animal Physiology • Introduction to Ecology and Evolution • Introduction to microbes, plants, and animals • Biology and Chemistry Lab • Calculus • Statistics for Environmental Science.
Environmental Studies: Introduction to Environmental Studies • Critical Thinking and Reason in Environmental Studies • Low Carbon Environment

title: Travel
text:
One of my top interests is travel I love experiencing new environments and cultures, and I believe it is important push myself to learn about diverse places. Travel has allowed me to see a glimpse of the world and understand why it is so important that it is protected. I have listed some of my favorite travel destinations that inspire me to expand my knowledge and constantly see more!



Burney Falls, CA





Third Lake, Big Pine, CA





McKenzie River, OR





Arenal Volcano, Costa Rica





Trondheim, Norway





Vallersund, Norway





Swiss Alps, Switzerland

title: School and Work
text:
Research Projects
This is a research poster I did on genes involved in chemotaxis in C. elegans.
This is a research paper I did on the inheritance patterns of eye color genes in drosphila.

title: School and Work
text:
Experience
Animal Care Assistant, SB Wildlife Care Network, Santa Barbara, CA March 2024 - Present
-Keep track of strict feeding schedules ensuring all wildlife properly cared for.
-Maintain sanitary conditions throughout the facility by cleaning laundry, dishes, and equipment to establish a safe, hygienic environment for wildlife.
-Properly administer medications, give subcutaneous fluids, and identify common pathogens through microscopes.
Camp Counselor, Hephatha Lutheran School, Anaheim Hills, CA June 2023 - August 2023
-Collaborated effectively with other counselors and staff members to keep camp operations seamless.
-Committed to maintaining a safe and secure camp environment, by completing CPR and first aid training.
-Demonstrated effective organizational skills to plan and coordinate camp activities and meals, as well as clean and organize classrooms.
Sales Floor Associate, Kohls, Corona, CA July 2022 - Sept 2022
-Provided exceptional customer service by answering phone calls, assisting shoppers, and addressing issues promptly.
-Adapted between diverse roles such as cash register operations, customer service, and dressing room attendant.
